Convert SRT to VTT with HappyScribe

This guide explains how to convert SRT files to VTT files quickly and accurately. You’ll learn technical details, command-line FFmpeg steps, Python snippets, batch methods, and how to use HappyScribe’s API and subtitle editor for seamless conversions.

What are SRT and VTT subtitle formats?

SRT is a plain text subtitle format using sequential cues and timecodes in Hours:Minutes:Seconds,Milliseconds separated by commas. It works with many legacy players and simple editors.

VTT (WebVTT) adds a mandatory WEBVTT header and uses dots in timecodes. It integrates natively with HTML5 video, supports basic CSS styling, positioning, and accessibility tags.

Why use HappyScribe for your subtitle conversion?

HappyScribe offers an API for batch workflows, a subtitle editor for manual tweaks, and both Automatic transcription and Human-made subtitles services. You can convert srt to vtt with confidence and polish captions in one platform.

How to convert SRT to VTT using FFmpeg commands?

FFmpeg is a versatile tool for converting media formats. To convert a single file, use:

  • ffmpeg -i input.srt output.vtt

To batch convert on Mac or Linux, run:

  • for f in *.srt; do ffmpeg -i "$f" "${f%.srt}.vtt"; done

How to convert SRT to VTT using a Python script?

You can add a WEBVTT header and replace commas with dots in timecodes. Example:

  • with open('input.srt') as f: lines = f.read()
  • with open('output.vtt','w') as out: out.write('WEBVTT\n\n' + lines.replace(',', '.'))

How to convert SRT to VTT in Adobe Premiere or other editors?

In Premiere Pro go to File > Export > Captions. Export as .srt, then run the FFmpeg command or upload to HappyScribe’s Caption generator. This method works on both Mac and Windows.

Can I convert SRT to VTT online for free?

Yes, you can try HappyScribe with a free trial. Upload your files, choose VTT, and download formatted captions. No software install needed, and you can edit results in the subtitle editor instantly.

Next steps for your subtitle workflow

Ready to streamline captioning at scale? Use our API for batch jobs, or fine-tune with our Human-made subtitles service. Whether you work on web video, e-learning, or social media, HappyScribe has you covered.

faq.question: What is the main difference between SRT and VTT?
faq.answer: SRT lacks a file header and uses commas in timecodes, while VTT requires a WEBVTT header and uses dots. VTT also supports basic styling and HTML5 integration.

faq.question: How can I batch convert SRT files to VTT?
faq.answer: Use a shell loop with FFmpeg or the HappyScribe API to process multiple .srt files automatically. The FFmpeg loop works on Mac, Linux, and WSL.

faq.answer: Absolutely. You can use any text editor or HappyScribe’s subtitle editor to adjust cues, add styling tags, or correct captions.
